997  //============================================================================
998  // Method Description:
1010  template<typename dtype>
1011  bool allclose(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2, double inTolerance)
1012  {
1013  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
1014  {
1015  std::string errStr = "ERROR: allclose: input array dimensions are not consistant.";
1016  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1017  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1018  }
1019 
1020  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray1.size(); ++i)
1021  {
1022  if (std::abs(inArray1[i] - inArray2[i]) > inTolerance)
1023  {
1024  return false;
1025  }
1026  }
1027 
1028  return true;
1029  }

1082  //============================================================================
1083  // Method Description:
1096  template<typename dtype>
1097  NdArray<dtype> append(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inAppendValues, Axis inAxis)
1098  {
1099  switch (inAxis)
1100  {
1101  case Axis::NONE:
1102  {
1103  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() + inAppendValues.size());
1104  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
1105  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(), inAppendValues.cend(), returnArray.begin() + inArray.size());
1106 
1107  return std::move(returnArray);
1108  }
1109  case Axis::ROW:
1110  {
1111  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
1112  Shape appendShape = inAppendValues.shape();
1113  if (inShape.cols != appendShape.cols)
1114  {
1115  std::string errStr = "ERROR: append: all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly";
1116  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1117  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1118  }
1119 
1120  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows + appendShape.rows, inShape.cols);
1121  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
1122  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(), inAppendValues.cend(), returnArray.begin() + inArray.size());
1123 
1124  return std::move(returnArray);
1125  }
1126  case Axis::COL:
1127  {
1128  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
1129  Shape appendShape = inAppendValues.shape();
1130  if (inShape.rows != appendShape.rows)
1131  {
1132  std::string errStr = "ERROR: append: all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly";
1133  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1134  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1135  }
1136 
1137  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, inShape.cols + appendShape.cols);
1138  for (uint32 row = 0; row < returnArray.shape().rows; ++row)
1139  {
1140  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), returnArray.begin(row));
1141  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(row), inAppendValues.cend(row), returnArray.begin(row) + inShape.cols);
1142  }
1143 
1144  return std::move(returnArray);
1145  }
1146  default:
1147  {
1148  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
1149  // of the compiler warning.
1150  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1151  }
1152  }
1153  }
1154 
1155  //============================================================================
1156  // Method Description:
1175  template<typename dtype>
1176  NdArray<dtype> arange(dtype inStart, dtype inStop, dtype inStep)
1177  {
1178  if (inStep > 0 && inStop < inStart)
1179  {
1180  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: stop value must be larger than the start value for positive step.";
1181  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1182  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1183  }
1184 
1185  if (inStep < 0 && inStop > inStart)
1186  {
1187  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: start value must be larger than the stop value for negative step.";
1188  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1189  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1190  }
1191 
1192  std::vector<dtype> values;
1193 
1194  dtype theValue = inStart;
1195 
1196  if (inStep > 0)
1197  {
1198  while (theValue < inStop)
1199  {
1200  values.push_back(theValue);
1201  theValue += static_cast<dtype>(inStep);
1202  }
1203  }
1204  else
1205  {
1206  while (theValue > inStop)
1207  {
1208  values.push_back(theValue);
1209  theValue += static_cast<dtype>(inStep);
1210  }
1211  }
1212 
1213  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
1214  }
1215 
1216  //============================================================================
1217  // Method Description:
1235  template<typename dtype>
1236  NdArray<dtype> arange(dtype inStop)
1237  {
1238  if (inStop <= 0)
1239  {
1240  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: stop value must ge greater than 0.";
1241  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1242  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1243  }
1244 
1245  return std::move(arange<dtype>(0, inStop, 1));
1246  }

1742  //============================================================================
1743  // Method Description:
1754  template<typename dtype>
1755  NdArray<double> average(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inWeights, Axis inAxis)
1756  {
1757  switch (inAxis)
1758  {
1759  case Axis::NONE:
1760  {
1761  if (inWeights.shape() != inArray.shape())
1762  {
1763  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weight values are not consistant.";
1764  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1765  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1766  }
1767 
1768  NdArray<double> weightedArray(inArray.shape());
1769  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1770 
1771  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1772  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum /= inWeights.template sum<double>().item() };
1773 
1774  return std::move(returnArray);
1775  }
1776  case Axis::COL:
1777  {
1778  Shape arrayShape = inArray.shape();
1779  if (inWeights.size() != arrayShape.cols)
1780  {
1781  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weights value are not consistant.";
1782  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1783  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1784  }
1785 
1786  double weightSum = inWeights.template sum<double>().item();
1787  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, arrayShape.rows);
1788  for (uint32 row = 0; row < arrayShape.rows; ++row)
1789  {
1790  NdArray<double> weightedArray(1, arrayShape.cols);
1791  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1792 
1793  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1794  returnArray(0, row) = sum / weightSum;
1795  }
1796 
1797  return std::move(returnArray);
1798  }
1799  case Axis::ROW:
1800  {
1801  if (inWeights.size() != inArray.shape().rows)
1802  {
1803  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weight values are not consistant.";
1804  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1805  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1806  }
1807 
1808  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
1809 
1810  Shape transShape = transposedArray.shape();
1811  double weightSum = inWeights.template sum<double>().item();
1812  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, transShape.rows);
1813  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
1814  {
1815  NdArray<double> weightedArray(1, transShape.cols);
1816  std::transform(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1817 
1818  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1819  returnArray(0, row) = sum / weightSum;
1820  }
1821 
1822  return std::move(returnArray);
1823  }
1824  default:
1825  {
1826  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
1827  // of the compiler warning.
1828  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
1829  }
1830  }
1831  }

1849  //============================================================================
1850  // Method Description:
1867  template<typename dtype>
1868  NdArray<dtype> bincount(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint16 inMinLength)
1869  {
1870  // only works with integer input types
1871  static_assert(DtypeInfo<dtype>::isInteger(), "ERROR: bincount: can only use with integer types.");
1872 
1873  dtype maxValue = inArray.max().item();
1874  if (maxValue < 0)
1875  {
1876  // no positive values so just return an empty array
1877  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1878  }
1879 
1880  if (maxValue + 1 > DtypeInfo<dtype>::max())
1881  {
1882  std::string errStr = "Error: bincount: array values too large, will result in gigantic array that will take up alot of memory...";
1883  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1884  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1885  }
1886 
1887  uint16 outArraySize = std::max(static_cast<uint16>(maxValue + 1), inMinLength);
1888  NdArray<dtype> clippedArray = inArray.clip(0, maxValue);
1889 
1890  NdArray<dtype> outArray(1, outArraySize);
1891  outArray.zeros();
1892  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
1893  {
1894  ++outArray[clippedArray[i]];
1895  }
1896 
1897  return std::move(outArray);
1898  }

1900  //============================================================================
1901  // Method Description:
1921  template<typename dtype>
1922  NdArray<dtype> bincount(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inWeights, uint16 inMinLength)
1923  {
1924  // only works with integer input types
1925  static_assert(DtypeInfo<dtype>::isInteger(), "ERROR: bincount: can only use with integer types.");
1926 
1927  if (inArray.shape() != inWeights.shape())
1928  {
1929  std::string errStr = "ERROR: bincount: weights array must be the same shape as the input array.";
1930  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1931  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1932  }
1933 
1934  dtype maxValue = inArray.max().item();
1935  if (maxValue < 0)
1936  {
1937  // no positive values so just return an empty array
1938  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1939  }
1940 
1941  if (maxValue + 1 > DtypeInfo<dtype>::max())
1942  {
1943  std::string errStr = "Error: bincount: array values too large, will result in gigantic array that will take up alot of memory...";
1944  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1945  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1946  }
1947 
1948  uint16 outArraySize = std::max(static_cast<uint16>(maxValue + 1), inMinLength);
1949  NdArray<dtype> clippedArray = inArray.clip(0, maxValue);
1950 
1951  NdArray<dtype> outArray(1, outArraySize);
1952  outArray.zeros();
1953  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
1954  {
1955  outArray[clippedArray[i]] += inWeights[i];
1956  }
1957 
1958  return std::move(outArray);
1959  }

2152  //============================================================================
2153  // Method Description:
2163  template<typename dtype>
2164  NdArray<dtype> column_stack(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList)
2165  {
2166  // first loop through to calculate the final size of the array
2167  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
2168  Shape finalShape;
2169  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2170  {
2171  if (finalShape.isnull())
2172  {
2173  finalShape = iter->shape();
2174  }
2175  else if (iter->shape().rows != finalShape.rows)
2176  {
2177  std::string errStr = "ERROR: column_stack: input arrays must have the same number of rows.";
2178  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2179  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2180  }
2181  else
2182  {
2183  finalShape.cols += iter->shape().cols;
2184  }
2185  }
2186 
2187  // now that we know the final size, contruct the output array
2188  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(finalShape);
2189  uint32 colStart = 0;
2190  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2191  {
2192  Shape theShape = iter->shape();
2193  for (uint32 row = 0; row < theShape.rows; ++row)
2194  {
2195  for (uint32 col = 0; col < theShape.cols; ++col)
2196  {
2197  returnArray(row, colStart + col) = iter->operator()(row, col);
2198  }
2199  }
2200  colStart += theShape.cols;
2201  }
2202 
2203  return std::move(returnArray);
2204  }
2205

2207  // Method Description:
2217  template<typename dtype>
2218  NdArray<dtype> concatenate(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList, Axis inAxis)
2219  {
2220  switch (inAxis)
2221  {
2222  case Axis::NONE:
2223  {
2224  uint32 finalSize = 0;
2225  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
2226  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2227  {
2228  finalSize += iter->size();
2229  }
2230 
2231  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, finalSize);
2232  uint32 offset = 0;
2233  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2234  {
2235  std::copy(iter->cbegin(), iter->cend(), returnArray.begin() + offset);
2236  offset += iter->size();
2237  }
2238 
2239  return std::move(returnArray);
2240  }
2241  case Axis::ROW:
2242  {
2243  return std::move(row_stack(inArrayList));
2244  }
2245  case Axis::COL:
2246  {
2247  return std::move(column_stack(inArrayList));
2248  }
2249  default:
2250  {
2251  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2252  // of the compiler warning.
2253  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2254  }
2255  }
2256  }

2412  // Method Description:
2422  template<typename dtype>
2423  NdArray<uint32> count_nonzero(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
2424  {
2425  switch (inAxis)
2426  {
2427  case Axis::NONE:
2428  {
2429  NdArray<uint32> count = { inArray.nonzero().size() };
2430  return count;
2431  }
2432  case Axis::COL:
2433  {
2434  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2435 
2436  NdArray<uint32> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
2437  returnArray.zeros();

2439  {
2440  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2441  {
2442  if (inArray(row, col) != static_cast<dtype>(0))
2443  {
2444  ++returnArray(0, row);
2445  }
2446  }
2447  }
2448 
2449  return std::move(returnArray);
2450  }
2451  case Axis::ROW:
2452  {
2453  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2454 
2455  NdArray<uint32> returnArray(1, inShape.cols);
2456  returnArray.zeros();
2457  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2458  {
2459  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2460  {
2461  if (inArray(row, col) != static_cast<dtype>(0))
2462  {
2463  ++returnArray(0, col);
2464  }
2465  }
2466  }
2467 
2468  return std::move(returnArray);
2469  }
2470  default:
2471  {
2472  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2473  // of the compiler warning.
2474  return std::move(NdArray<uint32>(0));
2475  }
2476  }
2477  }

2479  //============================================================================
2480  // Method Description:
2491  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
2492  NdArray<dtypeOut> cross(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2, Axis inAxis)
2493  {
2494  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
2495  {
2496  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: the input array dimensions are not consistant.";
2497  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2498  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2499  }
2500 
2501  switch (inAxis)
2502  {
2503  case Axis::NONE:
2504  {
2505  uint32 arraySize = inArray1.size();
2506  if (arraySize != inArray2.size() || arraySize < 2 || arraySize > 3)
2507  {
2508  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2509  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2510  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2511  }
2512 
2513  NdArray<dtype> in1 = inArray1.flatten();
2514  NdArray<dtype> in2 = inArray2.flatten();
2515 
2516  switch (arraySize)
2517  {
2518  case 2:
2519  {
2520  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1])
2521  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]) };
2522  return std::move(returnArray);
2523  }
2524  case 3:
2525  {
2526  dtypeOut i = static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[2])
2527  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[2]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1]);
2528  dtypeOut j = -(static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[2])
2529  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[2]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]));
2530  dtypeOut k = (static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1])
2531  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]));
2532 
2533  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { i, j, k };
2534  return std::move(returnArray);
2535  }
2536  default:
2537  {
2538  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2539  // of the compiler warning.
2540  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
2541  }
2542  }
2543  }
2544  case Axis::ROW:
2545  {
2546  Shape arrayShape = inArray1.shape();
2547  if (arrayShape != inArray2.shape() || arrayShape.rows < 2 || arrayShape.rows > 3)
2548  {
2549  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2550  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2551  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2552  }
2553 
2554  Shape returnArrayShape;
2555  if (arrayShape.rows == 2)
2556  {
2557  returnArrayShape = Shape(1, arrayShape.cols);
2558  }
2559  else
2560  {
2561  returnArrayShape = Shape(3, arrayShape.cols);
2562  }
2563 
2564  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(returnArrayShape);
2565  for (uint32 col = 0; col < arrayShape.cols; ++col)
2566  {
2567  int32 theCol = static_cast<int32>(col);
2568  NdArray<dtype> vec1 = inArray1({ 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 });
2569  NdArray<dtype> vec2 = inArray2({ 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 });
2570  NdArray<dtypeOut> vecCross = cross<dtypeOut>(vec1, vec2, Axis::NONE);
2571 
2572  returnArray.put({ 0, static_cast<int32>(returnArrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 }, vecCross);
2573  }
2574 
2575  return std::move(returnArray);
2576  }
2577  case Axis::COL:
2578  {
2579  Shape arrayShape = inArray1.shape();
2580  if (arrayShape != inArray2.shape() || arrayShape.cols < 2 || arrayShape.cols > 3)
2581  {
2582  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2583  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2584  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2585  }
2586 
2587  Shape returnArrayShape;
2588  if (arrayShape.cols == 2)
2589  {
2590  returnArrayShape = Shape(arrayShape.rows, 1);
2591  }
2592  else
2593  {
2594  returnArrayShape = Shape(arrayShape.rows, 3);
2595  }
2596 
2597  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(returnArrayShape);
2598  for (uint32 row = 0; row < arrayShape.rows; ++row)
2599  {
2600  int32 theRow = static_cast<int32>(row);
2601  NdArray<dtype> vec1 = inArray1({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.cols) });
2602  NdArray<dtype> vec2 = inArray2({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.cols) });
2603  NdArray<dtypeOut> vecCross = cross<dtypeOut>(vec1, vec2, Axis::NONE);
2604 
2605  returnArray.put({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(returnArrayShape.cols) }, vecCross);
2606  }
2607 
2608  return std::move(returnArray);
2609  }
2610  default:
2611  {
2612  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2613  // of the compiler warning.
2614  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
2615  }
2616  }
2617  }

2757  //============================================================================
2758  // Method Description:
2767  template<typename dtype>
2768  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<uint32>& inArrayIdxs, Axis inAxis)
2769  {
2770  // make sure that the indices are unique first
2771  NdArray<uint32> indices = unique(inArrayIdxs);
2772 
2773  switch (inAxis)
2774  {
2775  case Axis::NONE:
2776  {
2777  std::vector<dtype> values;
2778  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
2779  {
2780  if (indices.contains(i).item())
2781  {
2782  continue;
2783  }
2784 
2785  values.push_back(inArray[i]);
2786  }
2787 
2788  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
2789  }
2790  case Axis::ROW:
2791  {
2792  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2793  if (indices.max().item() >= inShape.rows)
2794  {
2795  std::string errStr = "ERROR: deleteIndices: input index value is greater than the number of rows in the array.";
2796  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2797  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2798  }
2799 
2800  uint32 numNewRows = inShape.rows - indices.size();
2801  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(numNewRows, inShape.cols);
2802 
2803  uint32 rowCounter = 0;
2804  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2805  {
2806  if (indices.contains(row).item())
2807  {
2808  continue;
2809  }
2810 
2811  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2812  {
2813  returnArray(rowCounter, col) = inArray(row, col);
2814  }
2815  ++rowCounter;
2816  }
2817 
2818  return std::move(returnArray);
2819  }
2820  case Axis::COL:
2821  {
2822  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2823  if (indices.max().item() >= inShape.cols)
2824  {
2825  std::string errStr = "ERROR: deleteIndices: input index value is greater than the number of cols in the array.";
2826  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2827  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2828  }
2829 
2830  uint32 numNewCols = inShape.cols - indices.size();
2831  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, numNewCols);
2832 
2833  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2834  {
2835  uint32 colCounter = 0;
2836  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2837  {
2838  if (indices.contains(col).item())
2839  {
2840  continue;
2841  }
2842 
2843  returnArray(row, colCounter++) = inArray(row, col);
2844  }
2845  }
2846 
2847  return std::move(returnArray);
2848 
2849 
2850  }
2851  default:
2852  {
2853  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2854  // of the compiler warning.
2855  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2856  }
2857  }
2858  }
2859 
2860  //============================================================================
2861  // Method Description:
2870  template<typename dtype>
2871  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const Slice& inIndicesSlice, Axis inAxis)
2872  {
2873  Slice sliceCopy(inIndicesSlice);
2874 
2875  switch (inAxis)
2876  {
2877  case Axis::NONE:
2878  {
2879  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.size());
2880  break;
2881  }
2882  case Axis::ROW:
2883  {
2884  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.shape().cols);
2885  break;
2886  }
2887  case Axis::COL:
2888  {
2889  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.shape().rows);
2890  break;
2891  }
2892  }
2893 
2894  std::vector<uint32> indices;
2895  for (uint32 i = static_cast<uint32>(sliceCopy.start); i < static_cast<uint32>(sliceCopy.stop); i += sliceCopy.step)
2896  {
2897  indices.push_back(i);
2898  }
2899 
2900  return std::move(deleteIndices(inArray, NdArray<uint32>(indices), inAxis));
2901  }
2902

2915  {
2916  NdArray<uint32> inIndices = { inIndex };
2917  return std::move(deleteIndices(inArray, inIndices, inAxis));
2918  }

2989  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend() - 1, inArray.cbegin() + 1, returnArray.begin(),
2990  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
2991 
2992  return std::move(returnArray);
2993  }
2994  case Axis::COL:
2995  {
2996  if (inShape.cols < 2)
2997  {
2998  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2999  }
3000

3002  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
3003  {

3005  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
3006  }
3007 
3008  return std::move(returnArray);
3009  }
3010  case Axis::ROW:

3018  Shape transShape = transArray.shape();
3019  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(transShape.rows, transShape.cols - 1);
3020  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
3021  {
3022  std::transform(transArray.cbegin(row), transArray.cend(row) - 1, transArray.cbegin(row) + 1, returnArray.begin(row),
3023  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
3024  }
3025 
3026  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
3027  }
3028  default:
3029  {
3030  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
3031  // of the compiler warning.
3032  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3033  }
3034  }

3537  {
3538  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);

3542  case Axis::COL:

3551  case Axis::ROW:
3552  {
3553  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = inArray.transpose();
3554  for (uint32 row = 0; row < returnArray.shape().rows; ++row)
3555  {
3556  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.end(row));
3557  }
3558  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
3559  }
3560  default:
3561  {
3562  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3563  }
3564  }

3832  //============================================================================
3833  // Method Description:
3845  template<typename dtype>
3846  NdArray<dtype> fromfile(const std::string& inFilename, const std::string& inSep)
3847  {
3848  boost::filesystem::path p(inFilename);
3849  if (!boost::filesystem::exists(inFilename))
3850  {
3851  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: input filename does not exist.\n\t" + inFilename;
3852  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3853  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3854  }
3855 
3856  if (inSep.compare("") == 0)
3857  {
3858  // read in as binary file
3859  std::ifstream in(inFilename.c_str(), std::ios::in | std::ios::binary);
3860  in.seekg(0, in.end);
3861  uint32 fileSize = static_cast<uint32>(in.tellg());
3862 
3863  FILE* filePtr = fopen(inFilename.c_str(), "rb");
3864  if (filePtr == NULL)
3865  {
3866  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: unable to open the file.";
3867  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3868  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3869  }
3870 
3871  char* fileBuffer = new char[fileSize];
3872  size_t bytesRead = fread(fileBuffer, sizeof(char), fileSize, filePtr);
3873  fclose(filePtr);
3874 
3875  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(reinterpret_cast<dtype*>(fileBuffer), static_cast<uint32>(bytesRead));
3876  delete[] fileBuffer;
3877 
3878  return std::move(returnArray);
3879  }
3880  else
3881  {
3882  // read in as txt file
3883  if (!(inSep.compare(" ") == 0 || inSep.compare("\t") == 0 || inSep.compare("\n") == 0))
3884  {
3885  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: only [' ', '\\t', '\\n'] seperators are supported";
3886  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3887  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3888  }
3889 
3890  std::vector<dtype> values;
3891 
3892  std::ifstream file(inFilename.c_str());
3893  if (file.is_open())
3894  {
3895  while (!file.eof())
3896  {
3897  std::string line;
3898  std::getline(file, line);
3899 
3900  std::istringstream iss(line);
3901  try
3902  {
3903  values.push_back(static_cast<dtype>(std::stod(iss.str())));
3904  }
3905  catch (const std::invalid_argument& ia)
3906  {
3907  std::cout << "Warning: fromfile: " << ia.what() << std::endl;
3909  }
3910  }
3911  file.close();
3912  }
3913  else
3914  {
3915  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: unable to open file.";
3916  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3917  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3918  }
3919 
3920  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
3921  }
3922  }

4080  //============================================================================
4081  // Method Description:
4093  template<typename dtype>
4094  std::pair<NdArray<uint32>, NdArray<double> > histogram(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint32 inNumBins)
4095  {
4096  if (inNumBins == 0)
4097  {
4098  std::string errStr = "ERROR: histogram: number of bins must be positive.";
4099  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4100  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4101  }
4102 
4103  NdArray<uint32> histo = zeros<uint32>(1, inNumBins);
4104 
4105  bool useEndPoint = true;
4106  NdArray<double> binEdges = linspace(static_cast<double>(inArray.min().item()),
4107  static_cast<double>(inArray.max().item()), inNumBins + 1, useEndPoint);
4108 
4109  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
4110  {
4111  // binary search to find the bin idx
4112  bool keepSearching = true;
4113  uint32 lowIdx = 0;
4114  uint32 highIdx = binEdges.size() - 1;
4115  while (keepSearching)
4116  {
4117  uint32 idx = (lowIdx + highIdx) / 2; // integer division
4118  if (lowIdx == highIdx || lowIdx == highIdx - 1)
4119  {
4120  // we found the bin
4121  ++histo[lowIdx];
4122  break;
4123  }
4124 
4125  if (inArray[i] > binEdges[idx])
4126  {
4127  lowIdx = idx;
4128  }
4129  else if (inArray[i] < binEdges[idx])
4130  {
4131  highIdx = idx;
4132  }
4133  else
4134  {
4135  // we found the bin
4136  ++histo[idx];
4137  break;
4138  }
4139  }
4140  }
4141 
4142  return std::move(std::make_pair(histo, binEdges));
4143  }

4260  //============================================================================
4261  // Method Description:
4278  template<typename dtype>
4279  NdArray<dtype> interp(const NdArray<dtype>& inX, const NdArray<dtype>& inXp, const NdArray<dtype>& inFp)
4280  {
4281  // do some error checking first
4282  if (inXp.size() != inFp.size())
4283  {
4284  std::string errStr = "ERROR: interp: inXp and inFp need to be the same size().";
4285  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4286  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4287  }
4288 
4289  if (inX.min().item() < inXp.min().item() || inX.max().item() > inXp.max().item())
4290  {
4291  std::string errStr = "ERROR: interp: endpoints of inX should be contained within inXp.";
4292  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4293  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4294  }
4295 
4296  // sort the input inXp and inFp data
4297  NdArray<uint32> sortedXpIdxs = argsort(inXp);
4298  NdArray<dtype> sortedXp(1, inFp.size());
4299  NdArray<dtype> sortedFp(1, inFp.size());
4300  for (uint32 i = 0; i < sortedXpIdxs.size(); ++i)
4301  {
4302  sortedXp[i] = inXp[sortedXpIdxs[i]];
4303  sortedFp[i] = inFp[sortedXpIdxs[i]];
4304  }
4305 
4306  // sort the input inX array
4307  NdArray<dtype> sortedX = sort(inX);
4308 
4309  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inX.size());
4310 
4311  uint32 currXpIdx = 0;
4312  uint32 currXidx = 0;
4313  while (currXidx < sortedX.size())
4314  {
4315  if (sortedXp[currXpIdx] <= sortedX[currXidx] && sortedX[currXidx] <= sortedXp[currXpIdx + 1])
4316  {
4317  double percent = static_cast<double>(sortedX[currXidx] - sortedXp[currXpIdx]) /
4318  static_cast<double>(sortedXp[currXpIdx + 1] - sortedXp[currXpIdx]);
4319  returnArray[currXidx++] = Utils::interp(sortedFp[currXpIdx], sortedFp[currXpIdx + 1], percent);
4320  }
4321  else
4322  {
4323  ++currXpIdx;
4324  }
4325  }
4326 
4327  return std::move(returnArray);
4328  }
4329 
4330  //============================================================================
4331  // Method Description:
4344  template<typename dtype>
4345  NdArray<dtype> intersect1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
4346  {
4347  std::vector<dtype> res(inArray1.size() + inArray2.size());
4348  std::set<dtype> in1(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
4349  std::set<dtype> in2(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
4350 
4351  typename std::vector<dtype>::iterator iter = std::set_intersection(in1.begin(), in1.end(),
4352  in2.begin(), in2.end(), res.begin());
4353  res.resize(iter - res.begin());
4354  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(res));
4355  }

4663  template<typename dtype>
4664  NdArray<dtype> linspace(dtype inStart, dtype inStop, uint32 inNum, bool endPoint)
4665  {
4666  if (inNum == 0)
4667  {
4668  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
4669  }
4670  else if (inNum == 1)
4671  {
4672  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart };
4673  return std::move(returnArray);
4674  }
4675 
4676  if (inStop <= inStart)
4677  {
4678  std::string errStr = "ERROR: linspace: stop value must be greater than the start value.";
4679  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4680  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4681  }
4682 
4683  if (endPoint)
4684  {
4685  if (inNum == 2)
4686  {
4687  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart, inStop };
4688  return std::move(returnArray);
4689  }
4690  else
4691  {
4692  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inNum);
4693  returnArray[0] = inStart;
4694  returnArray[inNum - 1] = inStop;
4695 
4696  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / (inNum - 1);
4697  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inNum - 1; ++i)
4698  {
4699  returnArray[i] = returnArray[i - 1] + step;
4700  }
4701 
4702  return std::move(returnArray);
4703  }
4704  }
4705  else
4706  {
4707  if (inNum == 2)
4708  {
4709  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / (inNum);
4710  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart, inStart + step };
4711  return std::move(returnArray);
4712  }
4713  else
4714  {
4715  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inNum);
4716  returnArray[0] = inStart;
4717 
4718  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / inNum;
4719  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inNum; ++i)
4720  {
4721  returnArray[i] = returnArray[i - 1] + step;
4722  }
4723 
4724  return std::move(returnArray);
4725  }
4726  }
4727  }

5332  //============================================================================
5333  // Method Description:
5344  template<typename dtype>
5345  NdArray<double> nanmean(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5346  {
5347  switch (inAxis)
5348  {
5349  case Axis::NONE:
5350  {
5351  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), 0.0,
5352  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5353 
5354  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), 0.0,
5355  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5356 
5357  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum /= numberNonNan };
5358 
5359  return std::move(returnArray);
5360  }
5361  case Axis::COL:
5362  {
5363  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5364  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5365  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5366  {
5367  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5368  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5369 
5370  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5371  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5372 
5373  returnArray(0, row) = sum / numberNonNan;
5374  }
5375 
5376  return std::move(returnArray);
5377  }
5378  case Axis::ROW:
5379  {
5380  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5381  Shape transShape = transposedArray.shape();
5382  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, transShape.rows);
5383  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
5384  {
5385  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5386  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5387 
5388  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5389  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5390 
5391  returnArray(0, row) = sum / numberNonNan;
5392  }
5393 
5394  return std::move(returnArray);
5395  }
5396  default:
5397  {
5398  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5399  // of the compiler warning.
5400  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
5401  }
5402  }
5403  }

5405  //============================================================================
5406  // Method Description:
5417  template<typename dtype>
5418  NdArray<dtype> nanmedian(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5419  {
5420  switch (inAxis)
5421  {
5422  case Axis::NONE:
5423  {
5424  std::vector<dtype> values;
5425  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
5426  {
5427  if (!std::isnan(inArray[i]))
5428  {
5429  values.push_back(inArray[i]);
5430  }
5431  }
5432 
5433  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5434  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5435  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { values[middle] };
5436 
5437  return std::move(returnArray);
5438  }
5439  case Axis::COL:
5440  {
5441  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5442  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5443  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5444  {
5445  std::vector<dtype> values;
5446  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5447  {
5448  if (!std::isnan(inArray(row, col)))
5449  {
5450  values.push_back(inArray(row, col));
5451  }
5452  }
5453 
5454  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5455  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5456  returnArray(0, row) = values[middle];
5457  }
5458 
5459  return std::move(returnArray);
5460  }
5461  case Axis::ROW:
5462  {
5463  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5464  Shape inShape = transposedArray.shape();
5465  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5466  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5467  {
5468  std::vector<dtype> values;
5469  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5470  {
5471  if (!std::isnan(transposedArray(row, col)))
5472  {
5473  values.push_back(transposedArray(row, col));
5474  }
5475  }
5476 
5477  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5478  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5479  returnArray(0, row) = values[middle];
5480  }
5481 
5482  return std::move(returnArray);
5483  }
5484  default:
5485  {
5486  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5487  // of the compiler warning.
5488  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
5489  }
5490  }
5491  }

5520  //============================================================================
5521  // Method Description:
5533  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
5534  NdArray<double> nanpercentile(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double inPercentile, Axis inAxis, const std::string& inInterpMethod)
5535  {
5536  if (inPercentile < 0 || inPercentile > 100)
5537  {
5538  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input percentile value must be of the range [0, 100].";
5539  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5540  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5541  }
5542 
5543  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") != 0 &&
5544  inInterpMethod.compare("lower") != 0 &&
5545  inInterpMethod.compare("higher") != 0 &&
5546  inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") != 0 &&
5547  inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") != 0)
5548  {
5549  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input interpolation method is not a vaid option.\n";
5550  errStr += "\tValid options are 'linear', 'lower', 'higher', 'nearest', 'midpoint'.";
5551  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5552  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5553  }
5554 
5555  switch (inAxis)
5556  {
5557  case Axis::NONE:
5558  {
5559  if (inPercentile == 0)
5560  {
5561  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
5562  {
5563  if (!isnan(inArray[i]))
5564  {
5565  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(inArray[i]) };
5566  return std::move(returnArray);
5567  }
5568  }
5569  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5570  }
5571  else if (inPercentile == 1)
5572  {
5573  for (int32 i = static_cast<int32>(inArray.size()) - 1; i > -1; --i)
5574  {
5575  if (!isnan(inArray[i]))
5576  {
5577  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(inArray[i]) };
5578  return std::move(returnArray);
5579  }
5580  }
5581  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5582  }
5583 
5584  std::vector<double> arrayCopy;
5585  uint32 numNonNan = 0;
5586  for (uint32 j = 0; j < inArray.size(); ++j)
5587  {
5588  if (!isnan(inArray[j]))
5589  {
5590  arrayCopy.push_back(inArray[j]);
5591  ++numNonNan;
5592  }
5593  }
5594 
5595  if (arrayCopy.size() < 2)
5596  {
5597  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5598  }
5599 
5600  int32 i = static_cast<int32>(std::floor(static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1) * inPercentile / 100.0));
5601  uint32 indexLower = static_cast<uint32>(clip<uint32>(i, 0, numNonNan - 2));
5602 
5603  std::sort(arrayCopy.begin(), arrayCopy.end());
5604 
5605  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") == 0)
5606  {
5607  double percentI = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5608  double fraction = (inPercentile / 100.0 - percentI) /
5609  (static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1) - percentI);
5610 
5611  double returnValue = arrayCopy[indexLower] + (arrayCopy[indexLower + 1] - arrayCopy[indexLower]) * fraction;
5612  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(returnValue) };
5613  return std::move(returnArray);
5614  }
5615  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("lower") == 0)
5616  {
5617  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
5618  return std::move(returnArray);
5619  }
5620  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("higher") == 0)
5621  {
5622  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
5623  return std::move(returnArray);
5624  }
5625  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") == 0)
5626  {
5627  double percent = inPercentile / 100.0;
5628  double percent1 = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5629  double percent2 = static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5630  double diff1 = percent - percent1;
5631  double diff2 = percent2 - percent;
5632 
5633  switch (argmin<double>({ diff1, diff2 }).item())
5634  {
5635  case 0:
5636  {
5637  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
5638  return std::move(returnArray);
5639  }
5640  case 1:
5641  {
5642  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
5643  return std::move(returnArray);
5644  }
5645  }
5646  }
5647  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") == 0)
5648  {
5649  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { (arrayCopy[indexLower] + arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) / 2.0 };
5650  return std::move(returnArray);
5651  }
5652  }
5653  case Axis::COL:
5654  {
5655  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5656 
5657  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5658  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5659  {
5660  NdArray<dtypeOut> outValue = nanpercentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row)),
5661  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod);
5662 
5663  if (outValue.size() == 1)
5664  {
5665  returnArray[row] = outValue.item();
5666  }
5667  else
5668  {
5669  returnArray[row] = Constants::nan;
5670  }
5671  }
5672 
5673  return std::move(returnArray);
5674  }
5675  case Axis::ROW:
5676  {
5677  NdArray<dtype> arrayTrans = inArray.transpose();
5678  Shape inShape = arrayTrans.shape();
5679 
5680  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5681  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5682  {
5683  NdArray<dtypeOut> outValue = nanpercentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(arrayTrans.cbegin(row), arrayTrans.cend(row)),
5684  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod);
5685 
5686  if (outValue.size() == 1)
5687  {
5688  returnArray[row] = outValue.item();
5689  }
5690  else
5691  {
5692  returnArray[row] = Constants::nan;
5693  }
5694  }
5695 
5696  return std::move(returnArray);
5697  }
5698  default:
5699  {
5700  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5701  // of the compiler warning.
5702  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5703  }
5704  }
5705  }
5706 
5707  //============================================================================
5708  // Method Description:
5719  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
5720  NdArray<dtypeOut> nanprod(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5721  {
5722  NdArray<dtype> arrayCopy(inArray);
5723  for (uint32 i = 0; i < arrayCopy.size(); ++i)
5724  {
5725  if (std::isnan(arrayCopy[i]))
5726  {
5727  arrayCopy[i] = 1;
5728  }
5729  }
5730 
5731  return std::move(prod<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy, inAxis));
5732  }

5799  //============================================================================
5800  // Method Description:
5811  template<typename dtype>
5812  NdArray<double> nanstd(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5813  {
5814  switch (inAxis)
5815  {
5816  case Axis::NONE:
5817  {
5818  double meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis).item();
5819  double sum = 0;
5820  double counter = 0;
5821  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
5822  {
5823  if (std::isnan(inArray[i]))
5824  {
5825  continue;
5826  }
5827 
5828  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(inArray[i]) - meanValue);
5829  ++counter;
5830  }
5831  NdArray<double> returnArray = { std::sqrt(sum / counter) };
5832  return std::move(returnArray);
5833  }
5834  case Axis::COL:
5835  {
5836  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5837  NdArray<double> meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis);
5838  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5839  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5840  {
5841  double sum = 0;
5842  double counter = 0;
5843  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5844  {
5845  if (std::isnan(inArray(row, col)))
5846  {
5847  continue;
5848  }
5849 
5850  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col)) - meanValue[row]);
5851  ++counter;
5852  }
5853  returnArray(0, row) = std::sqrt(sum / counter);
5854  }
5855 
5856  return std::move(returnArray);
5857  }
5858  case Axis::ROW:
5859  {
5860  NdArray<double> meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis);
5861  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5862  Shape inShape = transposedArray.shape();
5863  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5864  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5865  {
5866  double sum = 0;
5867  double counter = 0;
5868  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5869  {
5870  if (std::isnan(transposedArray(row, col)))
5871  {
5872  continue;
5873  }
5874 
5875  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(transposedArray(row, col)) - meanValue[row]);
5876  ++counter;
5877  }
5878  returnArray(0, row) = std::sqrt(sum / counter);
5879  }
5880 
5881  return std::move(returnArray);
5882  }
5883  default:
5884  {
5885  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5886  // of the compiler warning.
5887  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
5888  }
5889  }
5890  }
5891

5907  NdArray<dtype> arrayCopy(inArray);
5908  for (uint32 i = 0; i < arrayCopy.size(); ++i)
5909  {
5910  if (std::isnan(arrayCopy[i]))
5911  {
5912  arrayCopy[i] = 0;
5913  }
5914  }
5915 
5916  return std::move(sum<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy, inAxis));
5917  }

6192  //============================================================================
6193  // Method Description:
6210  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
6211  NdArray<dtypeOut> percentile(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double inPercentile, Axis inAxis, const std::string& inInterpMethod)
6212  {
6213  if (inPercentile < 0 || inPercentile > 100)
6214  {
6215  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input percentile value must be of the range [0, 100].";
6216  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
6217  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
6218  }
6219 
6220  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") != 0 &&
6221  inInterpMethod.compare("lower") != 0 &&
6222  inInterpMethod.compare("higher") != 0 &&
6223  inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") != 0 &&
6224  inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") != 0)
6225  {
6226  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input interpolation method is not a vaid option.\n";
6227  errStr += "\tValid options are 'linear', 'lower', 'higher', 'nearest', 'midpoint'.";
6228  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
6229  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
6230  }
6231 
6232  switch (inAxis)
6233  {
6234  case Axis::NONE:
6235  {
6236  if (inPercentile == 0)
6237  {
6238  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(*inArray.cbegin()) };
6239  return std::move(returnArray);
6240  }
6241  else if (inPercentile == 1)
6242  {
6243  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(*inArray.cend()) };
6244  return std::move(returnArray);
6245  }
6246 
6247  int32 i = static_cast<int32>(std::floor(static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1) * inPercentile / 100.0));
6248  uint32 indexLower = static_cast<uint32>(clip<uint32>(i, 0, inArray.size() - 2));
6249 
6250  NdArray<double> arrayCopy = inArray.template astype<double>();
6251  std::sort(arrayCopy.begin(), arrayCopy.end());
6252 
6253  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") == 0)
6254  {
6255  double percentI = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6256  double fraction = (inPercentile / 100.0 - percentI) /
6257  (static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1) - percentI);
6258 
6259  double returnValue = arrayCopy[indexLower] + (arrayCopy[indexLower + 1] - arrayCopy[indexLower]) * fraction;
6260  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(returnValue) };
6261  return std::move(returnArray);
6262  }
6263  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("lower") == 0)
6264  {
6265  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
6266  return std::move(returnArray);
6267  }
6268  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("higher") == 0)
6269  {
6270  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
6271  return std::move(returnArray);
6272  }
6273  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") == 0)
6274  {
6275  double percent = inPercentile / 100.0;
6276  double percent1 = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6277  double percent2 = static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6278  double diff1 = percent - percent1;
6279  double diff2 = percent2 - percent;
6280 
6281  switch (argmin<double>({ diff1, diff2 }).item())
6282  {
6283  case 0:
6284  {
6285  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
6286  return std::move(returnArray);
6287  }
6288  case 1:
6289  {
6290  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
6291  return std::move(returnArray);
6292  }
6293  }
6294  }
6295  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") == 0)
6296  {
6297  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>((arrayCopy[indexLower] + arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) / 2.0) };
6298  return std::move(returnArray);
6299  }
6300  }
6301  case Axis::COL:
6302  {
6303  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6304 
6305  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6306  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6307  {
6308  returnArray[row] = percentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row)),
6309  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod).item();
6310  }
6311 
6312  return std::move(returnArray);
6313  }
6314  case Axis::ROW:
6315  {
6316  NdArray<dtype> arrayTrans = inArray.transpose();
6317  Shape inShape = arrayTrans.shape();
6318 
6319  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6320  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6321  {
6322  returnArray[row] = percentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(arrayTrans.cbegin(row), arrayTrans.cend(row)),
6323  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod).item();
6324  }
6325 
6326  return std::move(returnArray);
6327  }
6328  default:
6329  {
6330  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6331  // of the compiler warning.
6332  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
6333  }
6334  }
6335  }

6568  template<typename dtype>

6659  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::remainder(static_cast<dtypeOut>(inValue1), static_cast<dtypeOut>(inValue2)); });
6660

6883  //============================================================================
6884  // Method Description:
6896  template<typename dtype>
6897  NdArray<dtype> roll(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, int32 inShift, Axis inAxis)
6898  {
6899  switch (inAxis)
6900  {
6901  case Axis::NONE:
6902  {
6903  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inArray.size();
6904  if (inShift > 0)
6905  {
6906  shift = inArray.size() - shift;
6907  }
6908 
6909  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
6910  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(), returnArray.begin() + shift, returnArray.end());
6911 
6912  return std::move(returnArray);
6913  }
6914  case Axis::COL:
6915  {
6916  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6917 
6918  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inShape.cols;
6919  if (inShift > 0)
6920  {
6921  shift = inShape.cols - shift;
6922  }
6923 
6924  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
6925  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6926  {
6927  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.begin(row) + shift, returnArray.end(row));
6928  }
6929 
6930  return std::move(returnArray);
6931  }
6932  case Axis::ROW:
6933  {
6934  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6935 
6936  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inShape.rows;
6937  if (inShift > 0)
6938  {
6939  shift = inShape.rows - shift;
6940  }
6941 
6942  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = inArray.transpose();
6943  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.cols; ++row)
6944  {
6945  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.begin(row) + shift, returnArray.end(row));
6946  }
6947 
6948  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
6949  }
6950  default:
6951  {
6952  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6953  // of the compiler warning.
6954  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
6955  }
6956  }
6957  }
6958 
6959  //============================================================================
6960  // Method Description:
6971  template<typename dtype>
6972  NdArray<dtype> rot90(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint8 inK)
6973  {
6974  inK %= 4;
6975  switch (inK)
6976  {
6977  case 1:
6978  {
6979  return std::move(flipud(inArray.transpose()));
6980  }
6981  case 2:
6982  {
6983  return std::move(flip(inArray, Axis::NONE));
6984  }
6985  case 3:
6986  {
6987  return std::move(fliplr(inArray.transpose()));
6988  }
6989  default:
6990  {
6991  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6992  // of the compiler warning.
6993  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
6994  }
6995  }
6996  }

7031  //============================================================================
7032  // Method Description:
7041  template<typename dtype>
7042  NdArray<dtype> row_stack(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList)
7043  {
7044  // first loop through to calculate the final size of the array
7045  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
7046  Shape finalShape;
7047  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
7048  {
7049  if (finalShape.isnull())
7050  {
7051  finalShape = iter->shape();
7052  }
7053  else if (iter->shape().cols != finalShape.cols)
7054  {
7055  std::string errStr = "ERROR: row_stack: input arrays must have the same number of columns.";
7056  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
7057  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
7058  }
7059  else
7060  {
7061  finalShape.rows += iter->shape().rows;
7062  }
7063  }
7064 
7065  // now that we know the final size, contruct the output array
7066  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(finalShape);
7067  uint32 rowStart = 0;
7068  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
7069  {
7070  Shape theShape = iter->shape();
7071  for (uint32 row = 0; row < theShape.rows; ++row)
7072  {
7073  for (uint32 col = 0; col < theShape.cols; ++col)
7074  {
7075  returnArray(rowStart + row, col) = iter->operator()(row, col);
7076  }
7077  }
7078  rowStart += theShape.rows;
7079  }
7080 
7081  return std::move(returnArray);
7082  }
7083 
7084  //============================================================================
7085  // Method Description:
7097  template<typename dtype>
7098  NdArray<dtype> setdiff1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
7099  {
7100  std::vector<dtype> res(inArray1.size() + inArray2.size());
7101  std::set<dtype> in1(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
7102  std::set<dtype> in2(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
7103 
7104  typename std::vector<dtype>::iterator iter = std::set_difference(in1.begin(), in1.end(),
7105  in2.begin(), in2.end(), res.begin());
7106  res.resize(iter - res.begin());
7107  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(res));
7108  }

7702  //============================================================================
7703  // Method Description:
7715  template<typename dtype>
7716  NdArray<double> trapz(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double dx, Axis inAxis)
7717  {
7718  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
7719  switch (inAxis)
7720  {
7721  case Axis::COL:
7722  {
7723  NdArray<double> returnArray(inShape.rows, 1);
7724  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
7725  {
7726  double sum = 0;
7727  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols - 1; ++col)
7728  {
7729  sum += static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col + 1) - inArray(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col));
7730  }
7731 
7732  returnArray[row] = sum * dx;
7733  }
7734 
7735  return std::move(returnArray);
7736  }
7737  case Axis::ROW:
7738  {
7739  NdArray<dtype> arrayTranspose = inArray.transpose();
7740  Shape transShape = arrayTranspose.shape();
7741  NdArray<double> returnArray(transShape.rows, 1);
7742  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
7743  {
7744  double sum = 0;
7745  for (uint32 col = 0; col < transShape.cols - 1; ++col)
7746  {
7747  sum += static_cast<double>(arrayTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayTranspose(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(arrayTranspose(row, col));
7748  }
7749 
7750  returnArray[row] = sum * dx;
7751  }
7752 
7753  return std::move(returnArray);
7754  }
7755  case Axis::NONE:
7756  {
7757  double sum = 0.0;
7758  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size() - 1; ++i)
7759  {
7760  sum += static_cast<double>(inArray[i + 1] - inArray[i]) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArray[i]);
7761  }
7762 
7763  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum * dx };
7764  return std::move(returnArray);
7765  }
7766  default:
7767  {
7768  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7769  // of the compiler warning.
7770  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
7771  }
7772  }
7773  }

7775  //============================================================================
7776  // Method Description:
7788  template<typename dtype>
7789  NdArray<double> trapz(const NdArray<dtype>& inArrayY, const NdArray<dtype>& inArrayX, Axis inAxis)
7790  {
7791  Shape inShapeY = inArrayY.shape();
7792  Shape inShapeX = inArrayX.shape();
7793 
7794  if (inShapeY != inShapeX)
7795  {
7796  std::string errStr = "ERROR: trapz: input x and y arrays should be the same shape.";
7797  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
7798  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
7799  }
7800 
7801  switch (inAxis)
7802  {
7803  case Axis::COL:
7804  {
7805  NdArray<double> returnArray(inShapeY.rows, 1);
7806  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShapeY.rows; ++row)
7807  {
7808  double sum = 0;
7809  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShapeY.cols - 1; ++col)
7810  {
7811  double dx = static_cast<double>(inArrayX(row, col + 1) - inArrayX(row, col));
7812  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(inArrayY(row, col + 1) - inArrayY(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArrayY(row, col)));
7813  }
7814 
7815  returnArray[row] = sum;
7816  }
7817 
7818  return std::move(returnArray);
7819  }
7820  case Axis::ROW:
7821  {
7822  NdArray<dtype> arrayYTranspose = inArrayY.transpose();
7823  NdArray<dtype> arrayXTranspose = inArrayX.transpose();
7824  Shape transShape = arrayYTranspose.shape();
7825  NdArray<double> returnArray(transShape.rows, 1);
7826  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
7827  {
7828  double sum = 0;
7829  for (uint32 col = 0; col < transShape.cols - 1; ++col)
7830  {
7831  double dx = static_cast<double>(arrayXTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayXTranspose(row, col));
7832  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(arrayYTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayYTranspose(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(arrayYTranspose(row, col)));
7833  }
7834 
7835  returnArray[row] = sum;
7836  }
7837 
7838  return std::move(returnArray);
7839  }
7840  case Axis::NONE:
7841  {
7842  double sum = 0.0;
7843  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArrayY.size() - 1; ++i)
7844  {
7845  double dx = static_cast<double>(inArrayX[i + 1] - inArrayX[i]);
7846  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(inArrayY[i + 1] - inArrayY[i]) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArrayY[i]));
7847  }
7848 
7849  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum };
7850  return std::move(returnArray);
7851  }
7852  default:
7853  {
7854  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7855  // of the compiler warning.
7856  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
7857  }
7858  }
7859  }
7860

7862  // Method Description:
7874  template<typename dtype>
7875  NdArray<dtype> tril(uint32 inN, int32 inOffset)
7876  {
7877  uint32 rowStart = 0;
7878  uint32 colStart = 0;
7879  if (inOffset > 0)
7880  {
7881  colStart = inOffset;
7882  }
7883  else
7884  {
7885  rowStart = inOffset * -1;
7886  }
7887 
7888  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inN);
7889  returnArray.zeros();
7890  for (uint32 row = rowStart; row < inN; ++row)
7891  {
7892  for (uint32 col = 0; col < row + colStart + 1 - rowStart; ++col)
7893  {
7894  if (col == inN)
7895  {
7896  break;
7897  }
7898 
7899  returnArray(row, col) = static_cast<dtype>(1);
7900  }
7901  }
7902 
7903  return std::move(returnArray);
7904  }

8072  //============================================================================
8073  // Method Description:
8084  template<typename dtype>
8085  NdArray<dtype> trim_zeros(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const std::string inTrim)
8086  {
8087  if (inTrim == "f")
8088  {
8089  uint32 place = 0;
8090  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
8091  {
8092  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8093  {
8094  break;
8095  }
8096  else
8097  {
8098  ++place;
8099  }
8100  }
8101 
8102  if (place == inArray.size())
8103  {
8104  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8105  }
8106 
8107  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() - place);
8108  std::copy(inArray.cbegin() + place, inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
8109 
8110  return std::move(returnArray);
8111  }
8112  else if (inTrim == "b")
8113  {
8114  uint32 place = inArray.size();
8115  for (uint32 i = inArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i)
8116  {
8117  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8118  {
8119  break;
8120  }
8121  else
8122  {
8123  --place;
8124  }
8125  }
8126 
8127  if (place == 0 || (place == 1 && inArray[0] == 0))
8128  {
8129  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8130  }
8131 
8132  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, place);
8133  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cbegin() + place, returnArray.begin());
8134 
8135  return std::move(returnArray);
8136  }
8137  else if (inTrim == "fb")
8138  {
8139  uint32 placeBegin = 0;
8140  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
8141  {
8142  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8143  {
8144  break;
8145  }
8146  else
8147  {
8148  ++placeBegin;
8149  }
8150  }
8151 
8152  if (placeBegin == inArray.size())
8153  {
8154  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8155  }
8156 
8157  uint32 placeEnd = inArray.size();
8158  for (uint32 i = inArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i)
8159  {
8160  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8161  {
8162  break;
8163  }
8164  else
8165  {
8166  --placeEnd;
8167  }
8168  }
8169 
8170  if (placeEnd == 0 || (placeEnd == 1 && inArray[0] == 0))
8171  {
8172  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8173  }
8174 
8175  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, placeEnd - placeBegin);
8176  std::copy(inArray.cbegin() + placeBegin, inArray.cbegin() + placeEnd, returnArray.begin());
8177 
8178  return std::move(returnArray);
8179  }
8180  else
8181  {
8182  std::string errStr = "ERROR: trim_zeros: trim options are 'f' = front, 'b' = back, 'fb' = front and back.";
8183  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8184  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8185  }
8186  }

8290  template<typename dtype>
8291  dtype unwrap(dtype inValue)
8292  {
8293  if (inValue < 0)
8294  {
8295  return inValue + 2 * Constants::pi;
8296  }
8297  else if (inValue >= 2 * Constants::pi)
8298  {
8299  return inValue - 2 * Constants::pi;
8300  }
8301  else
8302  {
8303  return inValue;
8304  }
8305  }

8366  // Method Description:
8378  template<typename dtype>
8379  NdArray<dtype> where(const NdArray<bool>& inMask, const NdArray<dtype>& inA, const NdArray<dtype>& inB)
8380  {
8381  auto shapeMask = inMask.shape();
8382  auto shapeA = inA.shape();
8383  if (shapeA != inB.shape())
8384  {
8385  std::string errStr = "ERROR: where: input inA and inB must be the same shapes.";
8386  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8387  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8388  }
8389 
8390  if (shapeMask != shapeA)
8391  {
8392  std::string errStr = "ERROR: where: input inMask must be the same shape as the input arrays.";
8393  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8394  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8395  }
8396 
8397  auto outArray = NdArray<dtype>(shapeMask);
8398 
8399  for (uint32 i = 0; i < shapeMask.size(); ++i)
8400  {
8401  if (inMask[i])
8402  {
8403  outArray[i] = inA[i];
8404  }
8405  else
8406  {
8407  outArray[i] = inB[i];
8408  }
8409  }
8410 
8411  return std::move(outArray);
8412  }
